meanings.definition: The mass or magnitude of something large.
meanings.sent1: The bulk of the mountain loomed over the valley.
meanings.sent2: The ship's cargo was mostly made up of the bulk of the supplies.
meanings.sent3: The elephant's bulk made it impossible to fit through the tiny door.
meanings.sent4: The bulk of the storm clouds darkened the sky ominously.
meanings.sent5: The bulk of the iceberg beneath the surface was a hidden danger to the ship.

meanings.definition: The main part or body of something.
meanings.sent1: The bulk of the book contained the crucial information.
meanings.sent2: The bulk of the team's effort went into the final project.
meanings.sent3: The bulk of the cake was devoured within minutes of being served.
meanings.sent4: The bulk of the population lived in the city center.
meanings.sent5: The bulk of the tree's branches provided shade on hot days.

meanings.definition: To be or appear to be massive in size.
meanings.sent1: The clouds began to bulk up before the storm.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler tried to bulk up for the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent3: I need to bulk up my savings before the big sale next month.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to bulk up its security measures after the breach.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's muscles seemed to bulk up as he prepared to fight the villain.
